description.narrative:
Oxfam, in partnership with International Institute for Sustainable Development, IISD has finalized the development of a Technical and Community Gendered tool for Meaningful engagement in Large Scale Land Based investment. The guide is intended to provide an overview of the key steps in the Large Scale Land Based Investment (LSLBI) process, defining what women and community engagement looks like through LSLBI processes. It seeks to provide a resource for women, communities and those seeking to empower them by addressing associated issues in a simplified manner The guide is specifically intended for use by women, communities, their organizers and their facilitators once they discover an LSLBI is proposed or underway in their area. The guide highlights five key entry points which communities can use to influence the LSLBI process through organized and targeted engagement. The guide is intended to help maximize women and community#s ability to engage meaningfully in LSLBI processes. The guide development process was informed by community consultations in sampled countries among Communities affected by LSLBI. The countries include Cameroon, Kenya, Senegal and Zambia. Whileby no means providing all the evidence required, the information gathered from these countries was critical in development of the tools.
Pilot Testing of the Gendered tools The proposed pilot exercise is intended to test the practicability of the guides while appreciating any flaws that may otherwise hinder the effective implementation of the tool. Pilot testing of the guide will allow for feedback and an opportunity to raise issues about confusion or uncertainty of processes provided in the guide. The feedback will further facilitate refinement of the guide to ensure easy of its implementation. Additionally, the pilot testing will allow for identification of sensitive issues that may otherwise hinder the effective implementation. The pilot testing exercise is critical as it provides an opportunity for communities to practically put the guide into real perspective, appreciate the step by step processes and the dynamics of using the tool in the future.
Objectives of Pilot testing of the tool 1. To explore issues that may potentially have an antagonistic impact on the tool implementation 2. To test the implementation approach and reliability of the process of implementation 3. To determine the acceptability of the tool among target audience 4. To test whether the tool meets its intended objectives

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.
